definition: to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: And the sign flashed out its warning in the words that it was forming.
sentences.chinese: 霓虹燈突然閃爍出警兆，警告的語句漸漸成型。

sentences.english: The local police station a rapid, in the tea house will present a two-person arrested.
sentences.chinese: 當地派出所迅速出警，在茶館內將二人抓了個現行。

definition: (of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to report a case to the authorities
to be informed of a case/to take a case/to contract for a job (as a freelancer)
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
